Eyes.Eye Drop: Eye Drop Patient is counselled on the use of eye drops: - Eye drops regimen and indication. - Technique to administer eye drops: 1. Wash hands and dry them. 2. Shake the bottle 3-5 times. Open bottle cap. 3. Tilt head up or lie down. Slowly pull down the lower eye lid. 4. Drop eye drops into the lower eye lid according to the amount of drops instructed. 5. Close the eyes and press on the inner corner of the eye for 1 minute for the medication to be absorbed. 6. Straighten your head and wipe away extra liquid around the eye. - Wait for 5 minutes before using another eye drop or eye ointment. - Storage of only one month after first opening. Patient understood well. Thank you.
Eyes.Eye Ointment: Eye Ointment Patient is counselled on the use of eye ointment: - Eye ointment regimen and indication. - Technique to administer eye ointment: 1. Wash hands and dry them. 2. Tilt head up or lie down. Open the cap. 3. Slowly pull down the lower eye lid. 4. Squeeze out about 1cm of ointment onto the lower eyelid direct from the tube. 5. Close the eyes and press on the inner corner of the eye for 1 minute for the medication to be absorbed. 6. Straighten head and wipe away extra liquid around the eye. -Eyesight may become blurred for a while after using the ointment. - Use eye drops first and wait for 5 minutes before eye ointment. Patient understood well. Thank you.

ENT.Nasal Spray: Nasal Spray Patient is counselled on the use of nasal spray: - Nasal spray name, regimen and indication. - Technique to administer nasal spray: 1. Blow the nose to clear it first. Wash hands and dry them. 2. Shake the bottle for 3-5 times. Open the cap. 3. Hold the bottle with thumb at bottom, while index and middle finger on top. 4. For first time use, prime by spraying 1-2 times until a fine mist is produced. 5. Tilt head forward slightly, insert nozzle into one nostril, point towards the eye of the same side, and close the other nostril with one finger. 6. Press the spray while breathing in slowly through nose. 7. Remove the nozzle from nostril and slowly breathe out through mouth. 8. Repeat for the other nostril. Wait for 1 minute for second dose if needed. 9. Wipe the nozzle clean and close it with cap. Patient understood well. Thank you.
ENT.Nasal Douche: Nasal Douche Patient is counselled on the use of nasal douche: - Nasal douche indication. - Technique to use nasal douche: 1. Prepare the solution by diluting 1 teaspoon of sodium bicarbonate powder into 240 mL of water. Use the syringe to take out 10mL and refill as needed. 2.Stand in front of the sink, lean head forward. 3. Insert syringe into nostril, point the syringe towards the inner area of the nose. 4. Breathe through the mouth. Press the plunger to produce a gentle flow. 5. The solution might flow into another nostril or into the mouth. Spit it out from the mouth. 6. Repeat a few times and change to another nostril. Patient understood well. Thank you.
ENT.Ear Drop: Ear Drop Patient is counselled on the use of ear drops: - Ear drop name, regimen and indication. - Technique to administer ear drop: 1. Wash hands and dry them. Sit in front of the mirror to see the position of the ear. 2. Shake the bottle 3-5 times. Open the cap. 3. Tilt head to one side or lie on the side so that the affected ear is facing upwards. 4. Pull the ear backward and upward to open the ear canal. (For child <3 years old, pull backward and downward) 5. Squeeze the correct amount of drops into the ear. 6. Maintain position for 5 minutes to allow draining of medication. 7. Straighten head and wipe off any excess liquid. Cap back the bottle. - Store for 1 month only after first opening. Patient understood well. Thank you.

Respiratory.MDI: MDI Patient is counselled on the use of MDI: -Inhalation regimen and administration -Use of reliever and preventer and their difference -Steps: 1. Hold the inhaler in an upright position. Remove the mouthpiece cover. Shake inhaler in an up-down motion 3-5 times. 2. Priming by press on canister 2-3 times until fine mist came out. 3. Exhale slowly and completely through mouth. 4. Place the mouthpiece at the lips. Make sure lips cover the mouthpiece tightly while the head slightly tilted. 5. Press the canister ONCE and inhale slowly and deeply through the mouth at the same time. 6. Hold breath for 10 seconds and exhale through nose. 7. Mouth rinsing (for steroid inhaler). 8. Wipe after every use and wash inhalers weekly under running tap water. -Wait for 30-60 seconds before the second puff Patient understood well. Thank you.
Respiratory.MDI + aerochamber: MDI with Aerochamber Patient is counselled on the use of MDI with aerochamber: -Inhalation regimen and administration -Use of reliever and preventer and their difference -Steps: 1. Shake before use an up-down motion 3-5 times, immediately before each use & remove the mouthpiece cover. 2. Priming by press on canister 2-3 times until fine mist came out. 3. Insert the MDI into into the backpiece of the chamber. 4. Put mouthpiece into mouth and close lips around it to ensure an effective seal. Apply mask to face and ensure an effective seal. Press the MDI canister ONCE. 5. Aerochamber with mouthpiece: - Breathe in slowly and deeply through the mouth.Hold breath for 5-10 seconds, if possible. Aerochamber with mask: - Maintain seal for 10 breaths after the MDI is pressed. 7. Remove the mask from face / detach lips from mouthpiece and remove the MDI from aerochamber after use. 8. Mouth rinsing after (for steroid inhaler). - Wait for 30-60 seconds before the next puff - Wash aerochamber once a week by soaking aerochamber in water for 30 minutes and agitate gently. Let air dry in standing position overnight. Do not brush or wipe the inner part of Aerochamber. Patient understood well. Thank you.

Use of reliever and preventer and their difference 3. Inhalation technique: - Priming - Hold the Turbuhaler upright. Turn the grip as far as it will go in one direction and turn it back again until the "CLICK" sound is heard. - Breathe out completely, away from the mouthpiece. - *Place mouthpiece gently between the lips. Make sure lips cover the mouthpiece tightly. Breathe in forcefully and deeply through the mouth.* - Hold breath for 5-10 seconds & then breathe out slowly. 4. Mouth rinsing after using inhaler 5. Wipe mouthpiece clean after every use using dry cloth. 6. Dose indicator: Turns red when 10 doses left 7. SMART therapy: - Take one more inhalation when having asthma symptoms. - Maximum 12 inhalations in one day. Patient understood well. Patient able to show satisfactory technique of using Symbicort turbuhaler. Patient able to inhale deeply and hold breathe for 10 seconds. Thank you.

Respiratory.Respimat: Respimat Patient is counselled on use of Spiriva/Spiolto Respimat Inhaler: 1. Inhalation regimen and administration - 2 puffs OD 2. Inhaler Preparation: - Insertion of cartridge - Marking check-box on inhaler’s label for each new cartridge inserted. - Priming 3. Inhalation technique - Hold the Respimat* upright with the cap closed. - Turn the clear base following arrows on the label until it "CLICKS" (half a turn). Open the green cap until it snaps fully open. - Breathe out slowly and fully, and close lips around the end of the mouthpiece without covering the air vent. Dose indicator: 60 doses full and turns red when 1 week doses left. 5. Cleaning of inhaler: Wipe clean after every use Patient understood well. Patient able to show satisfactory technique of using Respimat inhaler. Thank you.

Hold the base of the inhaler firmly and tilt the mouthpiece. 3. Remove one capsule from the blister and place it into the capsule chamber. Close the Breezehaler until a "CLICK" sound is heard. 4. Hold the Breezhaler upright with the mouthpiece pointing up. Pierce the capsule by do this only ONCE. Release the side buttons fully. 5. Breathe out fully, away from the mouthpiece. 6. Breathe in rapidly, steadily and deeply through the mouth until WHIRRING sound is heard. Breathe in rapidly, steadily through the mouth.until WHIRRING sound is heard. 7. Hold breath for 5-10 seconds and exhale through the nose. 8. Open the chamber to check if there is remaining powder, inhale once more if needed. 9. Open mouthpiece to remove the used capsule. 10. Cleaning and caring: Wipe clean mouthpiece with dry cloth after every use. Patient understood well. Patient able to show satisfactory technique of using Breezehaler. Thank you.

GIT.Enema: Enema Counselled patient on use of enema : - It is indicated to soften the faeces and helps it to be excreted easier. - Way to use: 1. Wash hands with soap and water. 2. Lie down on the side, keep the leg on the bottom straight and bend the leg on the top towards the chest. 3. Remove the cover of enema. Pull the buttock slightly upwards to open the rectum. 4. Insert the tip of enema into the rectum. Squeeze nearly all the liquid into the rectum. 5. Remove the enema and remain in position for at least 5 minutes. - Be somewhere near the washroom until the effect of medication is gone. - If it has no effect after 30 minutes, use one more dose. Patient understood well. Thank you.

Lift the buttock slightly and insert the suppository with the tip first using finger until it enters about 1 inch. 6. Remain in position for at least 5 minutes. 7. Wash hands again. - If the suppository is too soft, put it under running cold water or in the fridge for a few minutes to harden it back. Patient understood well. Thank you.
